result.execSummary:
The defendant David John Trovillion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If ES is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: Sentence def is currently serving in Ashland County Case #13CF19.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David John Trovillion

defendant.name: Trovillion, David John
defendant.address: P.O. Box 351, Waupun Correctional Inst., Waupun, WI 53963-0351

records.addlTxt: of Plea & Sentence held on 8-16-17

Defendant David John Trovillion in court, in custody, with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Spec. Pros calls cases 16CF30 and 16CF35 at 9:42 a.m.  Cites appearances and states agreement for Court.  Atty Randtke agrees as stated.  Def pleads NC to Count #1 in 16CF35 and Count #2 in 16CF30.  PLQ filed with Court.  Def admits signing document and giving answers without coercion.  Atty Randtke satisfied def freely, knowingly and intelligently pleads.  Court finds def guilty of counts as stated.  Right of allocution given but def has nothing for record.  Court follows agreement.  For Count #2 in 16CF30, Court sentences def to 12 months incarceration concurrent with Ashland County sentence.  Credit for time served.  On 16CF35, Count #1, Court sentences def to 1 year Prison/1 year ES, one set of court costs, consecutive to Ashland County case #13CF19 sentence def is currently serving.  Court determines def eligible for CIP and Substance Abuse Program.  Per atty Randtke, reiterates that time served on 16CF30.  Court agrees and dismisses other count addressed.  DNA sample and surcharge waived.  Sample on file.  Adj.  klr
to Produce/Transport
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney S. Joseph Randtke in court.  Def not present.  Frederick J. Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases at 10:08 a.m.  (Also calls 16CF30)  Cites appearances.  DA Schellgell gives court background re progress of cases.  Requests adjournment.  Court grants adjournment.  Cases to be scheduled.  Adjourned at 10:10 a.m.  klr
This bond covers 16CF30 and 16CF35.

David Trovillion appears, unrepresented.  Frederick j. Schellgell appears for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  Public defender information provided to defendant again.  DA requests bond be changed to a signature bond of $1,000 instead of a cash bond.  Court inquires if defendant would like to be heard.  Defendant indicates "no".  Court grants DA's motion to amend bond.  Bond covers both cases.  klr
Jury trial - 12 person on February 23, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David John Trovillion in court, lodged.   Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calls cases 16CF30 and 16CF35, cites appearances.  Prelim is needed in 16CF35.  Public defender information is given to def again.  Defendant addresses court.   States he has contacted PD and no attorney available until December.  Def states he wants to waive preliminary hearing.  Court questions def re waiver.  Defendant understands and still wants to waive prelim.  court grants waiver or prelim so continue to arraignment.  Information is given to court, copy to def.  Defendant understands charges on information.  Pleads NG.  Clerk to enter.  Set for trial.  Adj. at 11:35 a.m.
Status hearing on October 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David John Trovillion in court.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case.  Cites appearances.  Public defender information was given to defendant again to contact.  All rights are preserved by court.  State objects to T/L for prelim as already waived.  Court agrees.  Court questions defendant re: counsel.  May want to represent himself.  Bond to continue.  klr

records.addlTxt: Defendant David John Trovillion in court with attorney Sam Filippo (court grants special appearance).  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case.  Court allows special appearance of atty Filippo.  Public Defender to make determination if def still eligible.  Complaint is served by DA on atty.  Defendant was served previously.  Filippo waives reading.  Def aware of substance of charge.  Waives time limits to prelim but prelim to be set.  Court grants waiver.  Prelim to be scheduled.  Bond continues and covers both cases.  klr Defendant David John Trovillion in court with attorney Sam Joseph Filippo.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
